cost_breakdown.reasons: Extremely safe and comfortable but unacceptable efficiency as it fails to make meaningful progress by remaining behind a stopped vehicle when a safe overtake is possible.
Poor safety due to an overly wide trajectory that significantly reduces the margin to oncoming traffic. Efficiency is good but outweighed by the safety risk.
Optimal balance of all criteria. It executes a safe, comfortable, and efficient overtake maneuver, maintaining good progress while managing interactions with all other agents.
Unacceptable comfort due to extreme lateral jerk. The aggressive and late nature of the maneuver also compromises safety by getting too close to the lead vehicle.
